revised_title: Satellite Image Analysis Techniques for Oceanography
tldr: The article discusses the use of infrared and visible spectral sensors on spacecraft to provide imagery of ocean conditions, which can be analyzed using computer image processing techniques. The integration of satellite and conventional oceanographic data can provide a powerful analytical tool for modern ocean research. The article explains the physics and limitations of infrared and visible satellite data, the computer analysis techniques needed to exploit these data, and provides examples of combined satellite and conventional oceanographic data analyses of two ocean regions.
